My main work is done on a linux machine.

I am considering switching from Chemkin II to cantera but don't
have a Fortran-90 compiler.

The manual is not really explicit about what functionality will
be unavailable without  F90 compiler.
I would be happy to program completely in C++/python  if
that's a reasonable option.  

If F90 is really required, there seem to be many choices.
Intel has a fullfeatured eval download, and there are others -- 
any advice?

Finally, while I'm here -- 
given that Cantera is open source, how about
an interface to Scilab, or Octave (both matlab replacements).
I have a crude interface between Chemkin II and scilab
and will  at least scope out a cantera<->scilab connection.

		Thanks
			Steve
